title: Maze Happiness Calculation
problem_statement:
Maze Happiness Calculation

Eden University is holding a special Maze where Anya must participate. This maze is shaped like a grid of rooms, where each room is connected to its 4 adjacent rooms. Each room contains some number of peanuts and some number of carrots. Anya loves peanuts but hates carrots. Eating a peanut increases her happiness by 1, but eating a carrot decreases it by 1. Anya can go only east and south (right and down) from each room, and if she is in a room, she must eat all the peanuts and carrots in that room. Now, Loid being the super spy he is, stole the map of the Maze, which contains the number of peanuts and carrots in each room, and gave the map to Anya.

Anya is terrible at studies, so she asked you to help her calculate the maximum happiness she can achieve while going through the maze. She will always enter the Maze at the most north-west room (top left) and must reach the most south-east room (bottom right). Initially, Anya\'s happiness is 0.

Input Format

  • First line contains 2 integers, N and M, the dimensions of the grid.
  • The next N lines contain M space-separated integers each, where the jth integer of the ith line denotes the number of peanuts in the room.
  • The next N lines contain M space-separated integers each, where the jth integer of the ith line denotes the number of carrots in the room.

Output Format

Output a single integer, the maximum happiness Anya can achieve.

Constraints

  • 1 ≤ M, N ≤ 200
  • 0 ≤ Number of peanuts or carrots in room ≤ 100

Examples

Input:
3 3
2 6 2
1 6 2
6 3 2
1 3 1
1 5 1
4 2 1
Output:
7

To maximize happiness, Anya goes as follows:

  1. Initially happiness is 0.
  2. In the first room she eats 2 peanuts and 1 carrot, her happiness is 1 now. She goes east.
  3. In the second room she eats 6 peanuts and 3 carrots, her happiness is 4 now. She goes east.
  4. In the third room she eats 2 peanuts and 1 carrot, her happiness is 5 now. She goes south.
  5. In the fourth room she eats 2 peanuts and 1 carrot, her happiness is 6 now. She goes south.
  6. In the fifth room she eats 2 peanuts and 1 carrot, her happiness is 7 now. She has reached the most south-east room.

Her happiness is 7.

Code Template

#include <iostream>
#include <vector>
using namespace std;

int solution(vector<vector<int>> peanuts, vector<vector<int>> carrots) {
    // Write your code here
}

int main() {
    int n, m;
    cin >> n >> m;
    vector<vector<int>> peanuts(n, vector<int>(m, 0));
    vector<vector<int>> carrots(n, vector<int>(m, 0));
    
    for (int i = 0; i < n; i++) {
        for (int j = 0; j < m; j++) {
            cin >> peanuts[i][j];
        }
    }
    
    for (int i = 0; i < n; i++) {
        for (int j = 0; j < m; j++) {
            cin >> carrots[i][j];
        }
    }
    
    cout << solution(peanuts, carrots) << endl;
    return 0;
}
